senses.de: Having a large size from side to side.

Tips.title: Physical Width
Tips.description: Use 'broad' to describe something wide, like streets or rivers.
Tips.example: The table was so broad, all ten of us could sit around it comfortably.

Tips.title: Not for Thickness
Tips.description: 'Broad' refers to width, not thickness or depth.
Tips.example: Select a broad plank for the shelf, not a thick one.

senses.de: Including a lot of different people or things.
senses.ex: The conference attracted a broad range of people.

Tips.title: Variety of Elements
Tips.description: Use 'broad' to emphasize diversity in groups or collections.
Tips.example: Her music tastes are very broad, spanning classical to hip-hop.

Tips.title: Not Specific
Tips.description: 'Broad' implies a range without focusing on specifics or details.
Tips.example: We need a broad strategy that addresses all potential issues.

senses.ex: He gave a broad outline of the plans.

Tips.title: General Terms
Tips.description: 'Broad' suggests an overview without going into specifics.
Tips.example: He provided a broad description, leaving out the technical details.

Tips.title: Initial Stages
Tips.description: 'Broad' can indicate the starting point for a plan or idea before details are added.
Tips.example: Let's start with a broad concept and refine it later.

Tips.title: Easily Understood
Tips.description: 'Broad' means instructions or explanations are clear and simple.
Tips.example: She provided broad steps that anyone could follow.

senses.de: Refer to an accent, especially British ones that are not considered standard.
senses.ex: She speaks with a broad Yorkshire accent.

Tips.title: Clear Accent
Tips.description: 'Broad' refers to a strong and easily identifiable regional accent.
Tips.example: His broad Scottish accent made his hometown obvious.

Tips.title: Cultural Identity
Tips.description: A 'broad' accent often carries cultural implications and identity.
Tips.example: Her broad New Orleans accent revealed her cultural background.

senses.de: A derogatory term for a woman, considered disrespectful.
senses.ex: He referred to her as a broad, which she found offensive.

Tips.title: Dated Slang
Tips.description: Describing a woman as 'broad' is considered old-fashioned and offensive.
Tips.example: Refer to ladies respectfully, not as broads.

Tips.title: Avoid Using
Tips.description: Stay away from using 'broad' as slang for a woman to avoid disrespect.

Ample.wordDefinition:
Ample means "enough or more than enough" and is commonly used to describe a sufficient amount of something. For example, "There is ample time to finish the project before the deadline.".

For example, "The senator's platform had broad appeal across party lines."

Ample describes the quantity of something, while broad describes the scope or range of something.

Comprehensive.wordDefinition:
Comprehensive means covering everything in great detail and leaving nothing out.

A comprehensive report or study would include all relevant information and leave no stone unturned.

Comprehensive can describe things like a comprehensive health assessment or a comprehensive plan of action.

So while both words refer to covering a lot of ground, broad is used when you want to describe something on a high level, while comprehensive is used when you want to describe something in great detail.

Extensive.wordDefinition:
Broad usually refers to width or range, while extensive refers to the amount of something.

For example, a broad perspective means looking at something from a wide range of angles or viewpoints, while an extensive analysis means looking at a large amount of data or information.

Broad is more appropriate when you want to discuss the coverage or scope of something, while extensive is better when you want to describe the amount or quantity of something.

Liberal.wordDefinition:
Liberal means open-minded and tolerant, willing to accept different ideas and lifestyles. It is applicable in situations where we want to express a willingness to allow for different opinions, religions, or ways of life.

For example, a liberal attitude towards homosexuality means accepting and supporting it as a valid lifestyle choice.

Broad refers to something that is wide-ranging or general, while liberal refers to an open-minded and tolerant attitude towards different ideas or lifestyles.

Spacious.wordDefinition:
Broad refers to something that is wide or large in size, while spacious refers to something that has a lot of room or is open.

For example, a highway can be described as broad because it is wide, while a room can be described as spacious if it has a lot of open floor space.

Broad describes physical dimensions, while spacious describes the amount of room available within those dimensions.

Tolerant.wordDefinition:
Broad means having a wide and open-minded perspective, while the word tolerant means accepting of different beliefs, opinions, and behaviors.

Tolerant is applicable when someone is able to respect and accept differences among people, such as different cultures or lifestyles.

For example, a person who is tolerant might be able to understand and accept someone who has a different religion or political belief.

Overall, having a broad mindset and being tolerant are both important in building a more inclusive and understanding society.

Vast.wordDefinition:
The words broad and vast both describe things that are very large, but they differ in their specific meanings. Broad usually describes things that are wide or extensive, such as a broad road or a broad range of options.

It can also refer to a general or incomplete understanding of something, as in "broad knowledge." Vast, on the other hand, refers to things that are expansive or immense in size, such as a vast ocean or a vast amount of information.

Broad describes things that are wide or varied, while vast describes things that are incredibly large or expansive.

Wide.wordDefinition:
The words broad and wide have similar meanings, but they do have some differences.

Broad is typically used to describe something that has a large surface area or extensive range. For example, a broad smile is a big or wide smile that stretches across someone's face.

A broad avenue or street is a wide street or road with a lot of space.

Wide usually describes something that has a great distance between the two sides or a significant degree of openness. For example, a wide river is a river that is very expansive and takes up a lot of space.

A wide gap is a large space or opening between two things, and a wide screen TV is a television with a larger horizontal dimension compared to a traditional TV.

Broad is usually about the extent of something while wide is typically about the distance or degree of openness.

quotes.Text: What makes the meaning of life is people, so you try to be good to people immediately around you and in your broader community. So a lot of my projects are about how I can affect the world in the hundreds of millions.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Reid Hoffman

quotes.Text: Every teenager, I think, thinks it's the end of the world whenever anything happens, and it's not. You'll get through it. Life will be much more interesting and will certainly be broader when you're older.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Zelda Williams

quotes.Text: I believe everyone should have a broad picture of how the universe operates and our place in it. It is a basic human desire. And it also puts our worries in perspective.

quotes.Text: I would counsel people to go to college, because it's one of the best times in your life in terms of who you meet and develop a broad set of intellectual skills.

quotes.Text: He that raises a large family does, indeed, while he lives to observe them, stand a broader mark for sorrow; but then he stands a broader mark for pleasure too.

quotes.Text: I'm very simple. I have to be. I'm not very smart. I start broad, then go deep where I'm interested.

quotes.Text: Believe in life! Always human beings will live and progress to greater, broader, and fuller life.
